info.description:
# Overview Something new! Welcome Samsara's new and improved API. Check out our FAQ [here](https://developers.samsara.com/docs/introducing-our-next-generation-api) to see what's changed and learn how to get started.

Want to access the legacy API docs? You can find them [here](https://www.samsara.com/api).

*Note: Because this is a new set of APIs, we have not transitioned all endpoints over to this standard. Endpoints that still use the legacy standards are indicated in the reference documentation. If you can't find an API that you're looking for, we encourage you to look for it in our [legacy API docs](https://www.samsara.com/api) as we continue to transition all endpoints over. Check back here for updates!*

Submit your feedback [here](https://forms.gle/r4bs6HQshQAvBuwv6)! Samsara provides API endpoints so that you can build powerful applications and custom solutions with sensor data. Samsara has endpoints available to track and analyze sensors, vehicles, and entire fleets. The Samsara API is a [RESTful API](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_state_transfer). It uses standard [HTTP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypertext_Transfer_Protocol) authentication, verbs, and response codes, and it returns [JSON](http://www.json.org/) response bodies. If you're familiar with what you can build with a REST API, then this will be your go-to API reference. Visit [developers.samsara.com](https://developers.samsara.com) to find getting started guides and an API overview. If you have any questions, reach out to us at [support@samsara.com](mailto:support@samsara.com). ## Endpoints All our APIs can be accessed through HTTP requests to URLs like: ``` https://api.samsara.com/ ``` For EU customers, this URL will be: ``` https://api.eu.samsara.com/ ``` Note Legacy endpoints will have the URL: `https://api.samsara.com/v1/` or `https://api.eu.samsara.com/v1/` ## Authentication To authenticate your API request you will need to include your secret token. You can manage your API tokens in the [Dashboard](https://cloud.samsara.com). They are visible under `Settings->Organization->API Tokens`. Your API tokens carry many privileges, so be sure to keep them secure. Do not share your secret API tokens in publicly accessible areas such as GitHub, client-side code, and so on. Authentication to the API is performed via Bearer Token in the HTTP Authorization header. Provide your API token as the `access_token` value in an `Authorization: Bearer` header. You do not need to provide a password: ```curl Authorization: Bearer {access_token} ``` All API requests must be made over [HTTPS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTPS). Calls made over plain HTTP or without authentication will fail. ## Common Structures You can find more info about request methods, response codes, error codes, versioning, pagination, timestamps, and mini-objects [here](https://developers.samsara.com/docs/common-structures).
info.title: Samsara API

get.description: Returns a list of all addresses in an organization

parameters.description: The limit for how many objects will be in the response. Default and max for this value is 512 objects.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: If specified, this should be the endCursor value from the previous page of results. When present, this request will return the next page of results that occur immediately after the previous page of results.
parameters.name: after

200.description: List of all addresses in the organization

post.description: Creates a new address in the organization

parameters.description: The address to create.
parameters.name: address

200.description: Newly created address object with ID

get.summary: Get information about a specific address

200.description: Newly created address object with ID

patch.summary: Update information about a specific address

parameters.description: The address fields to update.
parameters.name: address

parameters.description: Unique Samsara ID for the address
parameters.name: id

get.description: Returns a list of all contacts in an organization.

parameters.description: The limit for how many objects will be in the response. Default and max for this value is 512 objects.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: If specified, this should be the endCursor value from the previous page of results. When present, this request will return the next page of results that occur immediately after the previous page of results.
parameters.name: after

post.description: Add a contact to the organization
post.summary: Add a contact to the organization

parameters.description: Add a contact.
parameters.name: contact

parameters.description: Updates to the contact.
parameters.name: contact

200.description: Updated contact object with given ID.

parameters.description: Unique identifier for the contact.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: If value is true, only drivers that are deactivated will appear in the response. This parameter will default to false if not provided (fetching only active drivers).
parameters.name: isDeactivated

parameters.description: The limit for how many objects will be in the response. Default and max for this value is 512 objects.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: If specified, this should be the endCursor value from the previous page of results. When present, this request will return the next page of results that occur immediately after the previous page of results.
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of tag IDs.
parameters.name: tagIds

post.description: Add a driver to the organization.

parameters.description: The driver to create.
parameters.name: driver

200.description: Newly created driver object, with Samsara-generated ID.

patch.description: Update a specific driver's information. This can also be used to activate or de-activate a given driver

parameters.description: Updates to the driver properties.
parameters.name: driver

parameters.description: ID of the driver. This can either be the Samsara-specified ID, or an external ID.
parameters.name: id

get.description: Returns a list of all vehicles in an organization, ordered by vehicle ID.

parameters.description: The limit for how many objects will be in the response. Default and max for this value is 512 objects.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: If specified, this should be the endCursor value from the previous page of results. When present, this request will return the next page of results that occur immediately after the previous page of results.
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of tag IDs.
parameters.name: tagIds

200.description: List of all vehicle objects, and pagination parameters.

get.description: Get information about a specific vehicle.

parameters.description: ID of the vehicle. This can either be the Samsara-specified ID, or an external ID.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: ID of the vehicle. This can either be the Samsara-specified ID, or an external ID.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Fields that can be patched on a vehicle.
parameters.name: vehiclePatchBody

parameters.description: Unique identifier for the vehicle.
parameters.name: id

get.description: Return all of the tags for an organization.

parameters.description: The limit for how many objects will be in the response. Default and max for this value is 512 objects.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: If specified, this should be the endCursor value from the previous page of results. When present, this request will return the next page of results that occur immediately after the previous page of results.
parameters.name: after

post.description: Create a new tag for the organization.

200.description: Newly created tag object, including the new tag ID.
The tag corresponding to request id.

put.description: Update a tag with a new name and new members. This API call would replace all old members of a tag with new members specified in the request body.

204.description: Successfully deleted the tag. No response body is returned.

parameters.description: Unique identifier for the tag.
parameters.name: id

parameters.name: after

parameters.description: The user to create.

get.description: This endpoint is still on our legacy API. Get the HOS (hours of service) signin and signout logs for the specified driver. The response includes 4 fields that are now deprecated.

parameters.description: Optional group ID if the organization has multiple groups (uncommon).
parameters.name: groupId

parameters.description: Driver ID to query.
parameters.name: driverId

parameters.description: Beginning of the time range, specified in milliseconds UNIX time.
parameters.name: startMs

parameters.description: End of the time range, specified in milliseconds UNIX time.
parameters.name: endMs

200.description: HOS authentication logs for the specified driver.

post.description: This endpoint is still on our legacy API. Get the HOS (hours of service) logs for the specified driver. This method returns all the HOS statuses that the driver was in during this time period.
post.summary: Get HOS logs for a specific driver

endMs.description: End of the time range, specified in milliseconds UNIX time.

groupId.description: Optional group ID if the organization has multiple groups (uncommon).

startMs.description: Beginning of the time range, specified in milliseconds UNIX time.

200.description: HOS logs for the specified driver.

get.description: This endpoint is still on our legacy API. Get the current HOS status for all drivers in the group. Note that this includes inactive as well as active drivers. You may need to upgrade your API token to version 2019-07-31 or later to leverage response pagination. [See here](https://kb.samsara.com/hc/en-us/articles/360026132972-Upgrading-API-Tokens)
get.summary: Get current HOS status for all drivers

parameters.description: Optional group ID if the organization has multiple groups (uncommon).
parameters.name: groupId

parameters.description: Pagination parameter indicating the cursor position to continue returning results after. Used in conjunction with the 'limit' parameter.
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: Pagination parameter indicating the number of results to return in this request. Used in conjunction with 'after'.
parameters.name: limit

200.description: HOS logs for the specified driver.

get.description: This endpoint is still on our legacy API. Get list of the vehicles with any engine faults or check light data.
get.summary: Get vehicles with engine faults or check lights

parameters.description: Optional group ID if the organization has multiple groups (uncommon).
parameters.name: groupId

200.description: List of vehicles and maintenance information about each.

get.description: This endpoint is still on our legacy API. Get historical trips data for specified vehicle. This method returns a set of historical trips data for the specified vehicle in the specified time range.

parameters.description: Optional group ID if the organization has multiple groups (uncommon).
parameters.name: groupId

parameters.description: Vehicle ID to query.
parameters.name: vehicleId

parameters.description: Beginning of the time range, specified in milliseconds UNIX time. Limited to a 90 day window with respect to startMs and endMs
parameters.name: startMs

parameters.description: End of the time range, specified in milliseconds UNIX time.
parameters.name: endMs

200.description: List of trips taken by the requested vehicle within the specified timeframe. Ongoing trips will be returned with 9223372036854775807 as their endMs.

Address.description: Information about an address/geofence. Geofences are either a circle or a polygon.

contacts.description: An array of all contact mini-objects that are associated with the given address entry.

id.description: Unique Samsara ID for the address.

latitude.description: Latitude of the address. Either inferred from the formatted address or defined on address creation.

longitude.description: Longitude of the address. Either inferred from the formatted address or defined on address creation.

tags.description: An array of all tag mini-objects that are associated with the given address entry.

AddressCore.description: Core fields used in both address creation and the actual address object.

addressTypes.description: Reporting location type associated with the address (used for ELD reporting purposes).

formattedAddress.description: The full street address for this address/geofence, as it might be recognized by Google Maps.
formattedAddress.example: 350 Rhode Island St, San Francisco, CA

notes.example: Hours of operation: 8am - 6pm; Truck entrance on the Rhode Island street side.

contactIds.description: An array of IDs of contacts to associate with this address.

latitude.description: Optional latitude field to override the geocoded latitude from the formatted address.

longitude.description: Optional longitude field to override the geocoded longitude from the formatted address.

tagIds.description: An array of IDs of tags to associate with this address.

AddressGeofenceRequest.description: The geofence that defines this address and its bounds. This can either be a circle, or a polygon - only one key should be provided, depending on the geofence type.

circle.description: Information about a circular geofence. This field is only needed if the geofence is a circle.

latitude.description: The latitude of the center of the circular geofence in decimal degrees.

longitude.description: The longitude of the center of the circular geofence in decimal degrees.

radiusMeters.description: The radius of the circular geofence in meters.

polygon.description: Information about a polygon geofence. This field is only needed if the geofence is a polygon.

vertices.description: The vertices of the polygon geofence. These geofence vertices describe the perimeter of the polygon, and must consist of at least 3 vertices and less than 40.

latitude.description: The latitude of a geofence vertex in decimal degrees.

longitude.description: The longitude of a geofence vertex in decimal degrees.

AddressGeofenceResponse.description: The geofence that defines this address and its bounds. This can either be a circle, or a polygon

circle.description: Information about a circular geofence. This field is only populated if the geofence is a circle.

latitude.description: The latitude of the center of the circular geofence in decimal degrees.

longitude.description: The longitude of the center of the circular geofence in decimal degrees.

radiusMeters.description: The radius of the circular geofence in meters.

polygon.description: Information about a polygon geofence. This field is only populated if the geofence is a polygon.

vertices.description: The vertices of the polygon geofence. These geofence vertices describe the perimeter of the polygon.

latitude.description: The latitude of a geofence vertex in decimal degrees.

longitude.description: The longitude of a geofence vertex in decimal degrees.

AddressPatch.description: Information about an address/geofence. Geofences are either a circle or a polygon.

contactIds.description: An array of IDs of contacts to associate with this address.

latitude.description: Optional latitude field to override the geocoded latitude from the formatted address.

longitude.description: Optional longitude field to override the geocoded longitude from the formatted address.

tagIds.description: An array of IDs of tags to associate with this address.

Contact.description: Information about a notification contact for alerts.

ContactInput.description: Information for adding a notification contact for alerts.

allOf.description: Vehicle that driver is currently assigned to.
Vehicle assigned to the driver for static vehicle assignments. (uncommon).

tags.description: The tags this driver belongs to.

allOf.description: Tag which determines which vehicles a driver will see when selecting vehicles.

carrierSettings.description: Carrier for a given driver. If the driver's carrier differs from the general organization's carrier settings, the override value is used. Updating this value only updates the override setting for this driver.

dotNumber.description: Carrier US DOT Number. If this differs from the general organization's settings, the override value is used. Updating this value only updates the override setting for this driver.

mainOfficeAddress.description: Main office address for a given driver. If this differs from the general organization's settings, the override value is used.

eldAdverseWeatherExemptionEnabled.description: Flag indicating this driver may use Adverse Weather exemptions in ELD logs.

eldBigDayExemptionEnabled.description: Flag indicating this driver may use Big Day exemption in ELD logs.

eldDayStartHour.description: `0` indicating midnight-to-midnight ELD driving hours, `12` to indicate noon-to-noon driving hours.

eldExempt.description: Flag indicating this driver is exempt from the Electronic Logging Mandate.

eldExemptReason.description: Reason that this driver is exempt from the Electronic Logging Mandate (see eldExempt).

eldPcEnabled.description: Flag indicating this driver may select the Personal Conveyance duty status in ELD logs.

eldYmEnabled.description: Flag indicating this driver may select the Yard Move duty status in ELD logs.

externalIds.description: User-defined dictionary of external IDs (string key-value pairs).

isDeactivated.description: A boolean that indicates whether or not this driver is deactivated.

licenseNumber.description: Driver's state issued license number. The combination of this number and `licenseState` must be unique.

licenseState.description: Abbreviation of state that issued driver's license.

notes.example: Also goes by the nickname Furious Fred.

timezone.description: Home terminal timezone, in order to indicate what time zone should be used to calculate the ELD logs.

username.description: Driver's login username into the driver app. The username may not contain spaces or the '@' symbol. The username must be unique.

carrierSettings.description: Carrier for a given driver. If the driver's carrier differs from the general organization's carrier settings, the override value is used. Updating this value only updates the override setting for this driver.

dotNumber.description: Carrier US DOT Number. If this differs from the general organization's settings, the override value is used. Updating this value only updates the override setting for this driver.

mainOfficeAddress.description: Main office address for a given driver. If this differs from the general organization's settings, the override value is used.

currentVehicleId.description: ID of vehicle that driver is currently assigned to.

eldAdverseWeatherExemptionEnabled.description: Flag indicating this driver may use Adverse Weather exemptions in ELD logs.

eldBigDayExemptionEnabled.description: Flag indicating this driver may use Big Day exemption in ELD logs.

eldDayStartHour.description: `0` indicating midnight-to-midnight ELD driving hours, `12` to indicate noon-to-noon driving hours.

eldExempt.description: Flag indicating this driver is exempt from the Electronic Logging Mandate.

eldExemptReason.description: Reason that this driver is exempt from the Electronic Logging Mandate (see eldExempt).

eldPcEnabled.description: Flag indicating this driver may select the Personal Conveyance duty status in ELD logs.

eldYmEnabled.description: Flag indicating this driver may select the Yard Move duty status in ELD logs.

externalIds.description: User-defined dictionary of external IDs (string key-value pairs).

licenseNumber.description: Driver's state issued license number. The combination of this number and `licenseState` must be unique.

licenseState.description: Abbreviation of state that issued driver's license.

locale.description: Locale override (uncommon). These are specified by ISO 3166-2 country codes for supported locales.

notes.example: Also goes by the nickname Furious Fred.

password.description: Password that the driver can use to login to the Samsara driver app.

staticAssignedVehicleId.description: ID of vehicle that the driver is permanently assigned to. (uncommon).

tagIds.description: IDs of tags the driver is associated with.

timezone.description: Home terminal timezone, in order to indicate what time zone should be used to calculate the ELD logs.

username.description: Driver's login username into the driver app. The username may not contain spaces or the '@' symbol. The username must be unique.

vehicleGroupTagId.description: Tag ID which determines which vehicles a driver will see when selecting vehicles.

activeHours.description: Hours spent on duty or driving, rounded to two decimal places.

activeMs.description: Milliseconds spent on duty or driving.

certified.description: Whether this HOS day chart was certified by the driver.

certifiedAtMs.description: Unix epoch time (in ms) of time when this chart was certified. If this chart is uncertified, 0.

distanceMiles.description: Distance driven in miles, rounded to two decimal places.

endMs.description: End of the HOS day, specified in milliseconds UNIX time.

shippingDocIds.description: List of customer shipping document IDs associated with the driver for the day.

startMs.description: End of the HOS day, specified in milliseconds UNIX time.

trailerIds.description: List of trailer ID's associated with the driver for the day.

vehicleIds.description: List of vehicle ID's associated with the driver for the day.

currentVehicleId.description: ID of vehicle that driver is currently assigned to.

password.description: Password that the driver can use to login to the Samsara driver app.

staticAssignedVehicleId.description: ID of vehicle assigned to the driver for static vehicle assignments. (uncommon).

tagIds.description: IDs of tags the driver is associated with.

vehicleGroupTagId.description: Tag ID which determines which vehicles a driver will see when selecting vehicles.

ErrorResponse.description: Error message describing why the request failed.

actionType.description: The log type - one of 'signin' or 'signout'

address.description: DEPRECATED: THIS FIELD IS NOT POPULATED

addressName.description: DEPRECATED: THIS FIELD IS NOT POPULATED

city.description: DEPRECATED: THIS FIELD IS NOT POPULATED

happenedAtMs.description: The time at which the event was recorded in UNIX milliseconds.

state.description: DEPRECATED: THIS FIELD IS NOT POPULATED

items.description: Ids of codrivers during any of the logged trips

hosStatusType.description: The Hours of Service status type. One of `OFF_DUTY`, `SLEEPER_BED`, `DRIVING`, `ON_DUTY`, `YARD_MOVE`, `PERSONAL_CONVEYANCE`.

locCity.description: City in which the log was recorded.

locLat.description: Latitude at which the log was recorded.

locLng.description: Longitude at which the log was recorded.

locName.description: Name of location at which the log was recorded.

locState.description: State in which the log was recorded.

logStartMs.description: The time at which the log/HOS status started in UNIX milliseconds.

remark.description: Remark associated with the log entry.

currentDutyStatusCode.description: The Hours of Service status type.

cycleRemaining.description: The amount of remaining cycle time (in ms).

cycleTomorrow.description: The amount of cycle time (in ms) available tomorrow.

driveMsToday.description: The amount of driving time today (in ms).

drivingInViolationCycle.description: The amount of driving time in violation in this cycle (in ms).

drivingInViolationToday.description: The amount of driving time in violation today (in ms).

onDutyMsToday.description: The amount of on duty time today (in ms).

pendingDriveMsToday.description: The amount of driving time today for pending logs (in ms).

pendingOnDutyMsToday.description: The amount of on duty time today for pending logs (in ms).

shiftDriveRemaining.description: The amount of remaining shift drive time (in ms).

shiftRemaining.description: The amount of remaining shift time (in ms).

timeInCurrentStatus.description: The amount of time (in ms) that the driver has been in the current `dutyStatus`.

timeUntilBreak.description: The amount of time (in ms) remaining until the driver cannot drive without a rest break.

endCursor.description: Cursor identifier representing the last element in the response. This value should be used in conjunction with a subsequent request's 'after' query parameter.

hasNextPage.description: True if there are more pages of results after this response.

addresses.description: The addresses that belong to this tag.

assets.description: The trailers, unpowered, and powered assets that belong to this tag.

drivers.description: The drivers that belong to this tag.

machines.description: The machines that belong to thistag.

parentTagId.description: If this tag is part a hierarchical tag tree, this is the ID of the parent tag, otherwise this will be omitted.

sensors.description: The sensors that belong to this tag.

vehicles.description: The vehicles that belong to this tag.

addresses.description: The addresses that belong to this tag.

assets.description: The trailers, unpowered, and powered assets that belong to this tag.

drivers.description: The drivers that belong to this tag.

machines.description: The machines that belong to this tag.

name.description: Name of this tag. Must be unique.

parentTagId.description: If this tag is part a hierarchical tag tree, this is the ID of the parent tag, otherwise this will be omitted.

sensors.description: The sensors that belong to this tag.

vehicles.description: The vehicles that belong to this tag.

id.description: Unique Samsara ID of this tag.

TripResponse.description: Contains the trips for the vehicle in the requested timeframe. A trip is represented as an object that contains startMs, startLocation, startAddress, startCoordinates, endMs, endLocation, endAddress and endCoordinates. Ongoing trips will be returned with 9223372036854775807 as their endMs.

distanceMeters.description: Length of the trip in meters.

endAddress.description: Text representation of nearest identifiable location to the end (latitude, longitude) coordinates.

endLocation.description: Geocoded street address of start (latitude, longitude) coordinates.

endMs.description: End of the trip in UNIX milliseconds. Ongoing trips are indicated by an endMs value of 9223372036854775807.

endOdometer.description: Odometer reading (in meters) at the end of the trip.

fuelConsumedMl.description: Amount in milliliters of fuel consumed on this trip.

startAddress.description: Text representation of nearest identifiable location to the start (latitude, longitude) coordinates.

startLocation.description: Geocoded street address of start (latitude, longitude) coordinates.
startLocation.example: 16 N Fair Oaks Ave, Pasadena, CA 91103

startMs.description: Beginning of the trip in UNIX milliseconds.

startOdometer.description: Odometer reading (in meters) at the beginning of the trip.

tollMeters.description: Length in meters trip spent on toll roads.

authType.description: The authentication type the user uses to authenticate. To use SAML this organization must have a configured SAML integration.

email.description: The email address of this user.

name.description: The first and last name of the user.

authType.description: The authentication type the user uses to authenticate. To use SAML this organization must have a configured SAML integration.

email.description: The email address of this user. This cannot be changed after creation.

name.description: The first and last name of the user.

roles.description: The roles for this user. Users must have at least a single role to be a part of an organization.

roleId.description: The id of the role the user has been granted.
The id of the role the user has been granted.

tagId.description: The id of the tag used to grant a role. If no tag is specified, this role applies at the organization level.

allOf.description: The id of the tag used to grant a role. If no tag is specified, this role applies at the organization level.

authType.description: The authentication type the user uses to authenticate. To use SAML this organization must have a configured SAML integration.

name.description: The first and last name of the user.

roles.description: The roles for this user. Users must have at least a single role to be a part of an organization.

VehicleListResponse.description: Response for retreiving a list of vehicles.

VehicleMaintenance.description: Contains any J1939/Passenger engine light warnings and engine faults.

j1939.description: J1939 based data. Null if no data is available.

passenger.description: Passenger vehicle data. Null if no data is available.

VehiclePatch.description: All the editable portions of the vehicle object.

auxInputType1.description: The type of aux input that this vehicle has connected to port 1. Setting to "none" will remove the configured aux input.

auxInputType2.description: The type of aux input that this vehicle has connected to port 2. Setting to "none" will remove the configured aux input.

engineHours.description: Current engine hours value of the vehicle. This is typically pulled automatically from the vehicle, but can be manually overridden when it's not read automatically.

externalIds.description: Dictionary of external IDs (key-value string pairs). Setting a value to "" will delete that external ID.

harshAccelerationSettingType.description: Enumeration of the harsh acceleration setting types. This setting influences the accelereation sensitivity from which a harsh event is triggered. If set to `off`, then no acceleration based harsh events are triggered for the vehicle.

licensePlate.description: License plate number for the vehicle.

notes.description: Notes about a vehicle with a maximum of 255 characters.
notes.example: These are notes about this given vehicle.

odometerMeters.description: Current odometer value of the vehicle. This is typically pulled automatically from the vehicle, but can be manually overridden when it's not read automatically.

staticAssignedDriverId.description: ID of driver assigned to the vehicle for static vehicle assignments. (uncommon).

tagIds.description: An array of IDs of tags to associate with this vehicle.

auxInputType1.description: The type of aux input that this vehicle has connected to port 1. Setting to "none" will remove the configured aux input.

auxInputType2.description: The type of aux input that this vehicle has connected to port 2. Setting to "none" will remove the configured aux input.

externalIds.description: Dictionary of external IDs (key-value string pairs).

harshAccelerationSettingType.description: Enumeration of the harsh acceleration setting types. This setting influences the acceleration sensitivity from which a harsh event is triggered. If set to `off`, then no acceleration based harsh events are triggered for the vehicle.

id.description: Unique Samsara ID for the vehicle.

licensePlate.description: The license plate of this vehicle.

notes.description: Notes about a vehicle. Samsara supports a maximum of 255 chars.
notes.example: These are notes about this given vehicle.

tags.description: An array of all tag mini-objects that are associated with the given vehicle.

endCursor.description: Cursor identifier representing the last element in the response. This value should be used in conjunction with a subsequent request's 'after' query parameter.

hasNextPage.description: True if there are more pages of results immediately available after this endCursor. Otherwise, wait nextPageAfter seconds before fetching the next page with endCursor.

id.description: The unique ID for the role.

groupIdBodyParam.description: Optional group ID if the organization has multiple groups (uncommon).
groupIdBodyParam.name: groupIdBodyParam

groupId.description: Optional group ID if the organization has multiple groups (uncommon).

groupIdParam.description: Optional group ID if the organization has multiple groups (uncommon).
groupIdParam.name: group_id

groupIdQueryParam.description: Optional group ID if the organization has multiple groups (uncommon).
groupIdQueryParam.name: groupId
